item.title: Report X-2025061333
item.description:
Report X-2025061333

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-17
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg is considered Undeclared as it is missing required Hazmat markings for shipment containing aerosols. Contents of original pkg repacked in FedEx repack box. Pkg was damaged at the origin terminal and Damaged Package Report (DPR) was filed. Required accompanying documents were not filed. Shipment "Service Code" designates Ltd Qty. Damaged portion (presumably non-hazardous cleaner) was removed from the original packaging and discarded. Remaining contents: laundry detergent, water filtration pitcher and sunscreen (aerosol) were repacked in the oversized FedEx carton with no packing material. Vent cap came off laundry detergent bottle allowing liquid to leak wetting and coating contents. Removal of pkg from sortation and inspection resulted in the discovery of the undeclared aerosol contents.

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-16
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Unmarked fiberboard box containing a 5gal plastic drum of corrosive liquid degreaser. Exterior box has no diamonds, orientation arrows, or OP-900. Package was initially flagged for the corroded external box while unloading a trailer. Hazmat was confirmed via litmus paper testing, and exact material was identified by product label on the side of the drum. The head of the drum appears to have been fitted incorrectly, as there is a gap on one side, allowing contents to spill out. External box appears to have absorbed the majority of the spill but was ruined in the process. No evidence of further spillage was observed.

item.title: Report E-2025060289
item.description:
Report E-2025060289

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-16
  • City: COUSHATTA
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A specification cargo tank 1,000 gallons or greater containing any hazardous materials that (1) received structural damage to the lading retention system or damage that requires repair to a system int
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RC FREIGHT LINES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Incident Report: Transportation Package Failure and Release Response Sequence of Events Leading to the Incident: On the morning of June 16, 2025, at 8:26 AM, Driver Carnest Nutall contacted dispatch to report that he had run his truck and trailer off the road and into a ditch at the curve where County Road 174 intersects Bob Wilson Road, while traveling northbound. The unit involved was Truck RC-34 pulling Trailer 107, both loaded with chemical product identified under BOL 1150607. The material being transported was M2Guard-HSR105G, manufactured by Foremark Performance for M2 Chemical. The driver was approximately 15 minutes from the delivery location at the time of the incident. Driver Nutall reported that he was unable to stop the truck and trailer due to apparent brake failure. The posted speed limit for the curve was 15 mph, as confirmed by photographs taken at the scene, which also documented tire marks showing the vehicle sliding off the road and rolling. Actions Taken at the Time of Discovery: The driver immediately notified dispatch and confirmed that he had sustained injuries to his head and lower back, but no other vehicles or individuals were involved. Local law enforcement was notified, and Officer Cliff Lance (Phone: 318-426-499) responded to the scene. The Louisiana State Police accident hotline was contacted at 10:19 AM; the call was taken by Amanda, who provided Incident #2121, which was initially given by Officer Lance. E3 Environmental was contacted to oversee environmental remediation and cleanup. They will be providing a cost estimate and handling hazardous materials containment. Nolan's Towing was notified to upright the truck and trailer and coordinate safe offloading of the contents. A secondary trailer, TX-18, operated by Driver Alan Reeves, was dispatched to receive the chemical transfer from the damaged trailer. Description of Package Failure: • The trailer was fully loaded with 45k of M2Guard-HSR105G at the time of the accident. Due to the trailer rolling into a ditch, there is potential for container displacement or compromise, though a full damage assessment was pending at time of report. While no visible punctures, cracks, or leaks were initially confirmed via driver call, an on-site inspection was ordered noticed some seepage from washout cap on dome lid area. Photographs taken at the scene showed clear evidence of road departure, slide marks, and the overturned position of the truck and trailer. • Any cracked, punctured, or ruptured drums will be identified by E3 Environmental and reported under separate documentation. Estimated Duration of Release: The exact duration of any material release is currently unknown pending E3's assessment. However, based on the time of the call (8:26 AM) and environmental response initiation (around 12:30 PM). Scene secured by law enforcement to prevent unauthorized access or ignition hazards. Environmental contractor (E3 Environmental) dispatched for cleanup, product containment, soi

  • Description: Supervisor, called Safety to report a spill involving trailer UN1219, ISOPROPANOL, Class 3, PG II, ERG 129 (Alcohol Isopropyl). Upon inspection, Employee noted that the spill had already dried. He observed that two boxes containing 1-gallon pails appeared to have been crushed due to the weight of a skid and the way it was loaded.~~Employee confirmed that there was no active spill in the trailer and that any liquid had already evaporated, consistent with the properties of alcohol. He placed the damaged containers and the crushed boxes into a recovery drum. He also stated that he would label the drum with the PRO number and contact ABF Safety Disposals for proper handling.~

item.title: Report X-2025061119
item.description:
Report X-2025061119

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-14
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF stated that while unloading the commodity they noticed the leaking commodity. ABF stated that it appears to have been forklift while being loaded at is previous location. A crew from TLE arrived on-site. Following a site assessment, TLE personnel noted two (2) pounds of sodium hydroxide was rele ased to the pallet and the concrete surfaces of the loading dock. TLE personnel overpacked the one (1) damaged 500-pound supersack of sodium hydroxide into one (1) 95-gallon overpack as hazardous waste. TLE personnel utilized one (1) HEPA vacuum to collect the released sodium hydroxide from the impa cted surfaces. TLE personnel cut up the impacted pallet as waste. All sodium hydroxide impacted material was collected in one (1) 95-gallon overpack as hazardous waste and staged on-site for further management. TLE personnel noted no further acitons required on-site and crews demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2025060295
item.description:
Report E-2025060295

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On June 13, 2025, one (1) 3,000-pound tote of sulfuric acid was damaged by an explosion inside the tote and released approximately two hundred (200) gallons of product to the trailer interior and terminal yard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. ES personnel deployed soda ash to the trailer interior, pavement and tires of nearby trailers. All sulfuric acid impacted material was collected and containerized into fifteen (15) 55-gallon drums and eleven (11) 35-gallon drums for future terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060296
item.description:
Report E-2025060296

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-13
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 13, 2025, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3264 was forked and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents and soda ash to the release and swept them in with hand tools. All poly aluminum hydroxychloride product was transferred from the damaged 330-gallon tote to a new 330-gallon tote and staged onsite. All spent absorbents were containerized in two 55-gallon drums, and crews cut down the damaged 330-gallon tote and placed that into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

The shipment was missing DG marking and is being held at the location.

item.title: Report E-2025060283
item.description:
Report E-2025060283

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-12
  • City: PRINCETON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 12, 2025, at 1542 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Inway personnel in Princeton, IL regarding the release of TRANSCHEM Muriatic Acid. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1.0 gallon of TRANSCHEM Muriatic Acid (UN1789, 8, II) from (1) 1-gallon plastic jug onto the trailer floor. The release was reportedly due to a load shift causing the jug to be smashed, impacting the trailer floor and 23 cardboard boxes containing (92) 1-gallon jugs of product. The release was cleaned with absorbent pads and the proper PPE. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. All jugs of product within the impacted cardboard boxes were removed from the boxes and containerized along with the damaged cardboard. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (4) 55-gallon DFs which were taken off-site by the contractor for proper disposal.

  • Description: On June 12, 2025, fifteen (15) 1-gallon jerricans of Mach Turbo were damaged during shipment and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer floor and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbent pads and neutralizing agents to remediate the impacted areas. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The fifteen (15) damaged jerricans were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

  • City: WHEELING

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 11, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of acetone was punctured by the shipper and released approximately four and a half (4.5) gallons of acetone to the trailer interior and concrete beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the site. The crew determined that the product had evaporated prior to their arrival. SET personnel collected the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060234
item.description:
Report E-2025060234

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-11
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CANTON RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Wednesday, June 11, 2025, at approximately 1730 hours, a CSXT crew noticed a tank car (UTLX 212517) leaking a liquid substance from the top of the car. After a call from the CSX Yardmaster at approximately 1733 hours, a Canton employee walked out to inspect the railcar. It was determined that the leak was coming from the top of the tank car, out of the pressure relief valve, located under the top fitting protection cover. This leak was due to the car being loaded during the winter months and the product inside the tank expanding due to sunlight warming the side of the tank, causing the contents to expand, thus reducing the available head space in the car. A Canton Railroad transload employee came out at 1907 hours and pumped 200 gallons out of the car to prevent further dripping out of the safety valve.

  • Description: During sort operations at the SEAR location A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed two plastic bottles inside that had warning stickers. After obtaining the SDS the contents were a class 8 UN3264. The outer fiberboard box didn't have any DG markings or paperwork required for transport. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location for the FAA.

  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 11, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was crushed by a loading strap during transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor, pallet, and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbent pads and cleaning agents to remediate the impacted areas. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060267
item.description:
Report E-2025060267

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-11
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 11, 2025, three (3) 1-gallon pails of paint were forked and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior, loading dock floor, and concrete beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged pails were placed in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, ONE AIR DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING. UPON INSPECTION OUTER BOX IS PACKAGED, MARKED AND LABELED AS ID8000 CONSUMER COMMODITY WITH THE CLASS 9 DIAMOND LABEL, AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING AND DECLARATION OF DANGEROUS GOODS. THE PACKAGE HAD PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY ON 05-JUNE-2025. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWELVE X ONE QUART CONTAINERS OF XPS COOLANT. ONE IS LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE.

  • Description: The forklift driver was consolidating freight into a trailer in preparation for transport to its destination facility. As the freight was being moved, the operator pushed the pallet into a piece of debris from a pallet on the ground which pushed into the pallet in front of it causing the unintentional release of corrosive liquid. Immediate action was taken by hazwoper personnel to limit the quantity of spilled liquid. The liquid was cleaned up with the use of absorbents and placed in an overpack container with the damaged box in a separate overpack container in preparation for disposition.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-10
  • City: LEHIGH ACRES
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 10, 2025, four (4) 1-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer floor and adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Safety (AS) to remediate the impacted site. Before AS personnel's arrival, onsite employees collected some released material and impacted wood into a trash can. AS personnel utilized absorbent pads to remediate the trailer floor and containerized the waste in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew transferred the contents of the trash can in the previously mentioned drum. All impacted pails were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.description:
Report X-2025060670

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-10
  • City: Dulles
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 06/09/2025 at approximately 2055, Dangerous Goods Administration received notification of a lithium battery fire. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box that appeared to contain 2 lithium batteries. During sort operations, the shipment began to smoke. The package was extinguished and submerged in water to neutralize the heat. Further investigation revealed that the battery shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork, deeming it undeclared dangerous goods. The package is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

  • Description: EIGHTY-SEVEN GROUND PACKAGES WERE STOPPED AND INSPECTED DUE TO MULTIPLE UNDECLARED PACKAGES BEING DISCOVERED THIS WEEK FROM THIS SHIPPER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EACH PACKAGE CONTAINS ONE FLAMMABLE UNIVERSAL GAS LIGHTER REFILLS. SOME PACKAGES CONTAIN NEON GAS LIGHTER REFILLS AT 300 ML. OTHER PACKAGES CONTAIN AMERICAN FUEL ZIPPO BUTANE AT 250 ML. THE PACKAGES ARE GOING TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA. THE PACKAGES WERE DROPPED OFF AT UPS ACCESS POINT LOCATION 7122 S SHERIDAN RD, TULSA OK 74133. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING AN INVALID UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER OF G012Y8.

  • Description: On June 9, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1791 was damaged in a load shift and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer floor and asphalt beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew containerized the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon overpack. HES personnel utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to collect all impacted material into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: Supervisor, contacted Safety to report a spill of UN1133, ADHESIVES, Class 3, Packing Group II, Bulk Packaging, in trailer #501504. Supervisor stated that approximately 32 ounces of the substance leaked onto the trailer floor from a 350-gallon metal tote.~~According to the Supervisor, the checke r opened the trailer doors and moved the first skid out, at which point the spill was discovered and immediately reported to him. CURA was contacted to assist with the cleanup of the spill in trailer #501504.~~The Supervisor noted that there was no visible damage to the metal tote and believes the leak occu rred during transit.~~Report has not been entered on online portal due to missing information. CURA advise what is damaged, how it was damaged, how much has spilled. ~~~CURA:~~TLE personnel have concluded cleanup efforts and are beginning to demobilize. They will be back onsite once the new tote has arrived. The tote has been placed into an empty trailer and moved to dock door 71. TLE has stressed that the tote should not be moved under any circumstances

  • Description: On June 9, 2025, twenty-two (22) 1-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel containerized the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew utilized absorbent pads, degreaser, and hand tools to clean the impacted trailer. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: On 6/8/2025 at approximately 0015, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4108415 at the ramp facility in Phoenix, reporting potentially undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consists of 2 plastic drums. The drums are marked with "Adhesive 53S" and are prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, not displaying the required markings, labeling, packaging, or paperwork. DG Administration was unable to locate a corresponding safety data sheet online for this commodity. The drums are being held for an FAA investigation.

item.description:
Report X-2025060653

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-06
  • City: TULSA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FORTY-NINE GROUND PACKAGES WERE STOPPED AND INSPECTED DUE TO PREVIOUS UNDECLARED PACKAGES BEING DISCOVERED FROM THIS SHIPPER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EACH PACKAGE CONTAINS ONE FLAMMABLE UNIVERSAL GAS LIGHTER REFILLS. SOME PACKAGES CONTAIN NEON GAS LIGHTER REFILLS AT 300 ML. OTHER PACKGES CONTAIN AMERICAN FUEL ZIPPO BUTANE AT 250 ML. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. PACKAGES ARE GOING TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA. THE PACKAGES WERE DROPPED OFF AT UPS ACCESS POINT LOCATION 7122 S SHERIDAN RD, TULSA OK 74133. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING AN INVALID UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER OF G012Y8.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=881789394246 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=1263 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=Paint PKG GRP=II SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=3.7 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=3.7 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter TECH NAME=Polane polyurethane enamel thermal red )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=881789394246 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=1263 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=paint related material PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=0.946 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=1 - Bottle TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=0.946 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter TECH NAME=Polane Catalyst )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=881789394246 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=2259 CLASS=80 PSN TEXT=Triethylenetetramine PKG GRP=II SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=1 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=C - Plastic NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=1 - Bottle TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=1 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter TECH NAME=Aradur HY 951 )On 6/6/2025 at approximately 1130, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 261690 at the ramp facility in Anchorage, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consisted of 3 different containers containing paint and one container holding a corrosive substance. The package showed signs of spillage on the outside. Further inspection revealed that one of the paint containers leaked inside of the package, resulting in spillage onto the other containers in the package. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The package is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

item.title: Report E-2025060153
item.description:
Report E-2025060153

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-06
  • City: YORK
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that twenty-five (25) gallons of material were released due to a puncture in one (1) 330-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel began the tote transfer and transferred eight hundred (800) liters of material. The damaged tote was cut up and placed into poly containers. The contaminated area was decontaminated, neutralized, and cleaned. The generated waste consists of five (5) 55-gallon poly drums containing impacted debris, absorbents, and cut-up tote pieces. All waste was staged onsite at bay 34. The contractor checked out with ESTES terminal employee Shane Smith. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: ABF stated they were unloading trailer 553002 they noticed 20 drums had resin on the inside of the shrink wrap and bottom of the drum. ABF stated they do not see an active leak however there is a substance on the inside of the shrink wrap and bottom of the drum. GES personnel inspected the spill-i mpacted 55-gallon drums of UN2922 and discovered that five (5) drums were transported with loose caps, which resulted in a release of approximately half (0.5) of a cup of material to the drums exteriors and trailer floor.

item.description:
Report E-2025060239

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-06
  • City: WEST CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VANGUARD LOGISTICS SERVICES (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipper advised the cargo was non-haz lead cans. Because its overpack crate broke in the ocean container from China to the U.S., our Chicago CFS discovered a package with a class 7 label and UN3332 markings. After speaking to the consignee we learned this classification was incorrect. The package was now classified as EMPTY and was UN2908. It was being returned to them because they are the manufacturer. They advised us how to correctly label and mark the package before they had it picked up.

The spill agent observed that the screw cap on the plastic jerrycan was loose causing the release also there was a tag attached with a wring label. A search for an SDS revealed the contents were a class 9 UN 3082. The outer fiberboard box did not have any DG markings or paperwork required for transport. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and are being held at the location.

  • Description: GROUND HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE. DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. IT APPEARS TO HAVE COME IN CONTACT WITH A SHARP OBJECT.

  • Description: On June 5, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3082 tipped over and damaged the cap. Due to the damage, the drum released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Marion Environmental (ME) to remediate the impacted site. The crew placed the damaged drum in one (1) 85-gallon overpack. Absorbent pads were utilized to collect the released material and were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-05
  • City: GREER
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 02/25/2025 at approximately 0645, Dangerous Goods Administration received notification from operations staff at the ramp facility in Greer, SC that the outer packaging of a shipment containing a declared Class 3 dangerous goods commodity was observed to be damp. The shipment consisted of one outer fiberboard box that contained one inner plastic bottle. Initially, the shipment was reported as sustaining outer package damage only with the damp outer packaging believed to result from an unknown external substance. However, when arranging for final disposition of the package on 6/5/2025, a visible tear in the tape used to secure the top onto the lid observed that had not been previously documented, changing the determination that the initial reported damp outer packaging. may have resulted from a small amount of leakage from the cap inner bottle.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon opening the trailer at the disposal facility, it was discovered that part of the load had shifted during transportation. Thirty 5-gallon pails containing lithium scrap soaked in mineral oil had shifted off the pallet and fell over in the nose of the trailer. One of the lids on a 5-gallon pail had loosened up as a result of the load shifting and began to leak. Approximately 0.25 gallons of material was spilled. The spill was contained and cleaned up appropriately. The material was then incinerated later the same day.

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-05
  • City: FRANKLIN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0900et the driver was performing a walk around of his equipment and noticed that there were some liquid dripping from the trailer onto the pavement. The driver put down some absorbent and then called our emergency response number. The response team was dispatched and showed up on site at 1045et. The team assessed the situation and began gaining access to the container that was leaking. The container was found and was repacked. The container had a small pinhole in it and only 1-2gallons was released. The team then did a final cleanup with absorbents and were collected and placed in the appropriate containers for proper disposal. The clean up was completed at 1300et.

The shipment contained one metal can that was dented on the sides, and this caused the lid to open spilling the contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was unloading a truck from a pick up of waste material from a customer on the previous day when he noticed liquid under a pallet. The drum was inspected and did not show any signs of leaking. The pallet containing the drum was moved off the truck. While moving the drum, it was noticed that a small amount of liquid was dripping from under the closure ring. The drum's ring was missing the closure nut and the closure ring's gasket was compromised.

item.description:
Report X-2025060645

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-04
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GROUND PACKAGE, FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY A LOADER ON THE PD2. THE LOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 5 MINUTES DONNING THE APPROPRIATE PPE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILLCART. USING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT ONE OF THE CAPS ON ONE OF THE INNER ONE GALLON PLASTIC CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 A TURN AND 6 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON.

item.description:
Report X-2025060462

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-04
  • City: NORTH CHARLESTON
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF Operation Supervisor states that driver Carmen Romano was on a forklift unloading a pallet into the hazmat bay when he struck a pallet of UN3066, PAINT RELATED MATERIAL, 8, PG II which spilled about 2 gallons onto Bay #4 (hazmat bay). ABF Supervisor states none of it had hit the yard. ABF Super visor states that she put down some duntage to stop the spill from additionally spreading. ABF Supervisor states that it looks like 2 pails might have been impacted but one is actively leaking. Safety contacted CURA and they had problems trying to find a vendor in the area that was available. CURA s tated that they contacted vendor First Call Environmental (FCE) that would be able to get on-site at the soonest as 3.5 hours. ABF Supervisor states that she would be going home but her dock hand Marcus Parson would be able to let the spill team in and service the spill.

  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 3, 2025, four (4) 1-gallon pails of UN2922 had a packaging error and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel collected the damaged pails and containerized them in one (1) lined box. The crew then utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum.

  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, ONE AIR PACKAGE BROKE OPEN REQUIRING A PACKAGE REWRAP. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED FOUR GAS ONE BUTANE FUEL GAS CARTRIDGES, EACH AT EIGHT OUNCE CAPACITY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM FLORIDA, DROPPED OFF AT A STORE IN HIALEAH-METRO, FLORIDA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 2451R8, MFN-AMAZON, 333 108TH AVE NE, BELLEVUE WA 98004-5703.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-03
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 3, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of sodium hydroxide solution fell over in transit due to improper securement and released approximately four (4) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbent pads and cleaning agents to wipe down the drum and impacted floor. ER personnel then replaced the bung on the drum and staged it onsite for further processing. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 5-gallon pail for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060168
item.description:
Report E-2025060168

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-03
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft-by-40ft area of the trailer floor and concrete dock floor and estimated that thirty (30) gallons of material was released due to one (1) 55-gallon metal drum being damaged. Before arrival, the terminal overpacked the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. Clean Harbors personnel applied absorbents to the affected areas on the trailer and dock. The overpack, impacted absorbents, boom, PPE, pads were all containerized into three (3) 55-gallon metal drums. Clean Harbors personnel staged the waste onsite and received approval from the Dayton Freight Lines manager. The generated waste will remain onsite for the Dayton Freight Lines team to coordinate disposal

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: GROUND STANDARD HAZARDOUS MATERIALS PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING. WITHIN 3 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE CLOSURES ON THE ONE LITER INNER PLASTIC CONTAINERS SEEMED TO BE CLOSED TIGHTLY BUT A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID MANAGED TO SEEP OUT AND SOAK A PORTION OF THE OUTER CARTON.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 2, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2922 was punctured in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew containerized the damaged drum in one (1) 85-gallon overpack for potential reuse. Granular absorbents and hand tools were used to remediate the impacted areas. All impacted material was containerized in two (2) 35-gallon drums for disposal.

  • City: TULSA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: RESPONDED TO OVER 100 GROUND UNMARKED PACKAGES DUE TO ONE PACKAGE NEEDING TO BE REWRAPPED PROMPTING AN INSPECTION OF ALL PACKAGES. PACKAGE SIZES ARE 8"X8"X3" APPROXIMATELY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS ALL PACKAGES CONTAIN ONE FLAMMABLE UNIVERSAL GAS LIGHTER REFILLS. SOME PACKAGES CONTAIN NEON GAS LIGHTER REFILLS AT 300 ML AND SOME PACKAGES CONTAIN AMERICAN FUEL ZIPPO BUTANE AT 250 ML. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY OF THE OUTER BOXES. PACKAGES ARE GOING TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA. THE PACKAGES WERE DROPPED OFF AT UPS ACCESS POINT 7122 S SHERIDAN RD, TULSA OK 74133. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING AN INVALID UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER OF G012Y8.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-30
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA

  • Description: GROUND PACKAGE HAD BEEN LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGE IN THE SORT. DURING PACKAGE REWRAP DISCOVERED TWO INNER BOXES MARKED AND LABELED UN2037 GAS CARTRIDGES WITH THE CLASS 2.1 DIAMOND LABEL. EACH BOX CONTAINS TWELVE FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF CHEF MASTER BUTANE FUEL, EACH AT 8 OZ CAPACITY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 02E939, DOVE MATERIAL SUPPLIERS USA, 141 CUPPED OAK RD, MATTHEWS NC 28104-8842.

  • Description: On May 30, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was forked and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. The crew taped the damaged drum and placed it in one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum. AS personnel utilized granular absorbents, absorbent pads, and hand tools to remediate the dock floor. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

The release impacted the trailer floor and area beneath the trailer.

item.description:
Report E-2025050568

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-29
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking fiber drum containing hazardous product, Resorcinol. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 2lb of product released onto the wooden trailer floor in a 1’ x 1’ area as a result of improper loading. A HEPA Vac was used to clean-up the release and the damaged, leaking drum was overpacked for waste disposal. Two 55-gallon DF’s and one 85-gallon DF was generated for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.description:
Report E-2025060069

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-29
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 29, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Morpholine 99% was damaged by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew placed the damaged drum of product into one (1) 95-gallon overpack for waste. Granular absorbents and soda ash were deployed to the release, worked in with hand tools, and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 29, 2025, one (1) 30-gallon drum of Formula 8410 (UN1814) was damaged by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer's interior, exterior, and the pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel utilized neutralizing agents and absorbent pads to remediate the impacted trailer. The crew used granular absorbents for the impacted pavement. All impacted media and absorbents were containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum. The damaged 30-gallon drum of product was placed in one (1) 55-gallon drum, which was then containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack drum.

  • Description: On May 28, 2025, six (6) 5-gallon pails of HS Enamel New Casella Blue (UN1263) were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the impacted site. ES+ personnel collected the six (6) damaged pails of paint and containerized them in two (2) 55-gallon drums. The crew then utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the trailer interior. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for future disposal.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: As a dockworker was unloading a trailer, he noticed that pallets were double stacked in front of the hazmat shipment. There was no dunnage used to separate the stacked pallet from the hazmat. As the shipment rode to its destination, the movement of the trailer caused the pallet to dig into the hazmat bags and rip them. The damaged bags were removed and placed in a plastic overpack container. All other spilled materials were cleaned up and placed in an overpack containers in preparation for disposition.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking tote containing hazardous product, STEAMATE LSA 1793. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 1-ounce release onto the wooden trailer floor from a defective gasket on the top of a hard plastic and metal tote. The contractor used absorbent pads to clean-up the release and then used those same pads to wrap the defective cap. No waste was generated from the response. The shipper was contacted to provide a new tote for the contractor to perform a tote transfer. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 27, 2025, fourteen (14) 5-gallon pails of printing ink were damaged due to a load shift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Carolina Environmental Response Team, Inc. (CERT) to remediate the site. Prior to their arrival, RLC personnel transferred the freight to the dock and the trailer was placed back in service. CERT personnel collected the damaged pails and containerized them in four (4) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050560
item.description:
Report E-2025050560

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-27
  • City: BROWNWOOD
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 27, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Waste Paint Related Material had a loose cap and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. Five (5) 55-gallon drums of the same product had swollen lids. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel patched the damaged drum of paint, then switched the swollen lids to vented bung lids on the five (5) swollen drums. The crew utilized volcanic ash and absorbent wipes to remediate the trailer floor All impacted material was collected in one (1) 5-gallon container for disposal.

REPSONDER BROUGHT THE LEAKER BACK TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. LEAKER WAS PROPERLY DISPOSED OF.

item.description:
Report X-2025052118

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-27
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Amanda Linebarger, 120/ABQ operations supervisor, reported a 1 lb spill of UN1485, Potassium Chlorate, 5.1, II in the nose of trailer 553264 and a small amount at dock door 70. Amanda advised this spill was discovered while unloading and appeared to have happened in transit. 120/ABQ contained the sp ill and Cura has been contacted to send a crew to remediate the spill. Safety asked Cura to have the crew confirm the cause of the spill and the amount spilled. ER personnel unstacked the pallet of potassium chlorate and discovered five (5) damaged 55-pound bags. Crews utilized a HEPA vac to collect all spilled material. All remaining freight was collecting into a cubic yard box for further handling by ABF. Crews collected five (5) damaged 55-pound bags of potassium chlorate into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All impacted PPE and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum. A ll collected waste was staged onsite for future transport and disposal by CES. Crews received site approval from Amanda Leinburg, secured the scene, and demobilized.

The crew patched the damaged tote, then utilized citric acid and absorbent pads to remediate the dock floor. All impacted materials were neutralized and containerized in one (1) 5-gallon pail for disposal.

Upon reloading the freight, the loader failed to properly secure the cargo resulting in it shifting forward causing the pallet to lean. The excess pressure created by the shift caused a small leak in one of the containers which was discovered as the freight was being staged on the dock. Once discovered, the spill was neutralized and cleaned up with absorbents. The damaged container and cleanup materials were placed in separate overpack containers in preparation for disposition.

item.title: Report E-2025050572
item.description:
Report E-2025050572

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-26
  • City: COLOGNE
  • State:
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN COLOGNE, GERMANY, ONE DANGEROUS GOODS AIR PACKAGE FROM GERMANY TO SWITZERLAND WAS FOUND LEAKING IN A WAREHOUSE CONTAINER. THE STEEL JERRICAN APPEARS DAMAGED AND CRUSHED BY AN UNKNOWN SOURCE. IT IS LEAKING FROM THE SEAM. THE SHIPMENT WAS OFFERED AS SINGLE PACKAGING IN A STEEL JERRICAN WITH AN APPROPRIATE DIAMOND LABEL, MARKS, AND SHIPPER'S DECLARATION FOR DANGEROUS GOODS. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. THE PACKAGE WAS DISPOSED OF PER NORMAL DISPOSAL PROCEDURES.

item.description:
Report X-2025060171

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-24
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=439291643445 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=No Release TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Loading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1197 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=Extracts, liquid PKG GRP=II CONTAINER CAPACITY=11.4 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=C - Plastic NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=4 NUMBER FAILED=1 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=11.4 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter )During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The shipment contained a plastic jerrycan which was leaking from the cap. This was part of a multi piece shipment and the leaking shipment damaged the fiberboard box of another in the shipment. Both were placed into steel salvage packages and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/23/2025 at approximately 2200 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 259484 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 6 steel drums overpacked onto a pallet. The shipment appears to have fallen due to a forklift accident resulting in spillage. One of the Class 9 drums and one of the Class 8 drums were compromised and spilled completely. The remainder of the package was rewrapped and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Description: On 5/23/2025 at approximately 2030 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 749919 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 3 fiberboard boxes, each containing 4 glass bottles of perfume. One of which appeared damaged, resulting in spillage. The cause of the damage is unknown. Other 2 packages were successfully delivered, and the unharried pieces of the damaged package were placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended Shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2025052227
item.description:
Report X-2025052227

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-23
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZ-MAT PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP ON 5/22/25, AT 11:40 PM. THE PACKAGE CAME FROM DOOR 36, ON THE C-UNLOAD. IN THE DMP PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN ONE, 5 GALLON METAL, CLOSED HEAD PAIL, WHICH CONTAINED DENCO NON-CHLOR. BRAKE PARTS CLEANER, BEING SHIPPED AS A FLAMMABLE HAZ-MAT PACKAGE (UN1993, FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS, N.O.S., (ACETONE, HEPTANE), 3, II,1, STEEL PAIL X 5 GALLON). THE METAL PAIL HAD BEEN BADLY DENTED INSIDE ITS CARTON AT SOMEPOINT WHCH ALLOWED A LARGE AMOUNT OF THE ACETONE, HEPTANE MIXTURE TO LEAK ONTO THE OUTSIDE CARTON. ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2025052229
item.description:
Report X-2025052229

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-23
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT APPROXIMATELY 17:30 THE SUPERVISOR FROM UNLOAD B CALLED DMP ABOUT A LEAKING PACKAGE IN DOOR 15. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER DONNED ALL APPROPRIATE PPE AND RETRIEVED A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER ARRIVING ON SCENE, THE RESPONDER NOTICED A HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH MOISTURE SEEPING OUT OF ONE OF THE CORNERS OF THE PACKAGE. THE RESPONDER THEN REFERRED TO THEIR DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET AND ACTED ACCORDINGLY. AFTER CLEANING UP ALL SPILL DEBRIS THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON OPENING THE SINGLEWALL FIBREBOARD BOX IT WAS DISCOVERED THE CAUSE OF THE LEAK WAS A PUNTURE HOLE IN THE BODY OF THE CONTAINER. THE PACKAGE WAS FINALLY DISPOSED OF ACCORDING TO THE DMP WASTE DISPOSAL FLOW CHART.

item.title: Report E-2025060297
item.description:
Report E-2025060297

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-23
  • City: ALTOONA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4570
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-40ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that five to ten (5-10) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Clean Harbors deployed granular absorbents to the affected area of the trailer floor. The contractor overpacked the damaged drum into one (1) 65-gallon metal drum. The granular absorbents were gathered and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums. Clean Harbors labeled the containers and staged the generated waste before they demobilized. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • City: CASEYVILLE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 0930 ct when the driver was unloading his truck he punctured drum with the forks of the forklift. There was approximately 20 gallons released to the back of the truck and onto the pavement under the unit. There were no waterway or soil impacted. Absorbent was immediately put in place and the drum was placed into a salvage container. The total time of the incident was about 20 minutes. We did call our internal response team to address the release area with a thorough cleaning and all absorbents that were used were placed into the appropriate container for disposal. Final clean up was complete by 1300 ct.

item.title: Report E-2025050510
item.description:
Report E-2025050510

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-23
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 23, 2025, one (1) 330-gallon tote of E-Pure MSA (UN3265) was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) ounces of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lewis Environmental Group (LEG) to remediate the impacted site. The crew conducted a tote transfer into one (1) new 330-gallon tote for continued shipment, then dismantled the damaged tote for disposal. LEG personnel utilized granular absorbents, absorbent pads, cleaning agents, and hand tools to remediate the site. The dismantled tote and all impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025052119
item.description:
Report X-2025052119

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-22
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Bryan Youtzy, 042 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding multiple hazard class spills on the trailer floor. Bryan Youtzy advised the spill appears to be caused by improper loading. Bryan Youtzy stated the freight was loaded on bars of the bulkhead and the freight slid forward while in-tra nsit. Bryan Youtzy advised due to the spill on the trailer floor and the freight being loaded on the bars, he's unable to locate the pros spilling. Bryan Youtzy advised the spill on the trailer wall as well. Safety reviewed what pros are loaded on the trailer and approximately 19 hazardous pros of S igma-Aldrich are loaded within the trailer. Safety advised Bryan Youtzy that CURA will be contacted for remediation. Safety contacted Cameron Kerr with CURA for remediation. FCE personnel noted six (6) damaged one-gallon jugs of UN1789 with approximately one gallon of product released to the trailer floor. An on-site RLC forklift was utilized to unload the trailer onto a poly sheeting staging area for better access to the spill. Crews utilized cleaners and absorbent pads to remove all free-standing product. The damaged jugs, all UN1789 impacted materials, and spent absorbents were collected an d containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums and five (5) five-gallon pails for disposal. The drums were properly labeled and staged on-site for further management.

item.description:
Report X-2025052173

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-22
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT APPROXIMATELY 18:30 THE SUPERVISOR FROM SORT AISLE A CALLED DMP ABOUT A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE SORT TABLE WHICH APPEARED TO BE A HAZMAT. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER DONNED ALL APPROPRIATE PPE AND RETRIEVED A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. UPON ARRIVAL A HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS SEEN LAYING ON ITS SIDE WITH A WET SPOT ON TWO CORNERS OF THE OUTER CARTON. AFTER REFERRING TO THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE RESPONDER ACTED ACCORDINGLY. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL MATERIALS WERE THEN DISPOSED OF ACCORDING TO THE DMP DISPOSAL FLOW CHART.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4in-by-4in area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that six (6) ounces of material were released due to a damaged valve and puncture in one (1) 2583-pound metal tote. Hepaco personnel determined a tote transfer would be needed. Hepaco wiped down the tote and started the tote transfer. They used a gravity transfer for the tote transfer to one (1) poly tote. No waste was generated from the cleanup or the tote transfer. Hepaco personnel staged the new tote on-site and set aside the damaged tote for Dayton to send back to the shipper, INX Lebanon.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 22, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of phosphoric acid fell over in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed neutralizing agent to the release, then utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect the released material into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack for disposal.

The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025052014
item.description:
Report X-2025052014

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-21
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED ABOUT A FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT LEAKING ON AN UNLOAD BULK SLIDE AT BAY 10. RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH PPE ON, SPILL CART, AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DECISION TREE, WHICH LED THEM TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET, WHICH LED THEM TO THE USE OF ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER USED ZEP ZORBENT AND CONTAINED THE OTHER HAZMAT PACKAGES THAT WERE CONTAMINATED FROM THE LEAKING FLAMMBLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH SPILL TUBS. RESPONDER CONTAINED THE LEAKING FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE AND USED ZEP ZORBENT INTO A SPILL TUB. RESPONDER HEADS BACK TO THE PSC CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT WASTE DISPOSAL FLOW CHART, WHICH LED THEM TO THE DMP PROCEDURE. RESPONDER SOLIDIFIED ALL CONTENTS WITH ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PUTS THE SOLIDIFIED CONTENTS AND OTHER CARDBOARD, PACKAGING MATERIAL, ECT. INTO 2 GREEN BAGS. RESPONDER DECONTAMINATED THEIR PPE FOR THE NEXT PICKUP.

THEY POINTED OUT A PACKAGE WITH A CLASS 8 HAZARD DIAMOND LABEL THAT WAS LEAKING A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID FROM ONE OF THE BOTTOM CORNERS OF THE BOX. INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTETNS SHOWED A 1 GAL CONTAINER THAT WAS LEAKING FROM THE SEAM IN THE SIDE OF THE CONTAINER.

item.title: Report X-2025052280
item.description:
Report X-2025052280

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-21
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WENT TO THE LOCATION AND OPENED THE BOX TO IDENTIFY THE SUBSTANCE AND SWEEP UP THE LOOSE SUBSTANCE FROM THE LOADING CHUTE. THERE WERE NO INDICATIONS ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE BOX THAT THERE WAS ANY SORT OF HAZARDOUS OR LIMITED QUANTITY ITEM IN THE BOX. WHEN THE BOX WAS OPENED, THE LID OF THE BUCKET WAS COMPLETELY LOOSE. UPON REMOVING THE BUCKET FROM THE BOX, RESPONDER NOTED BOTH THE OXIDIZER AND ENVIRONMENTAL DIAMOND HAZARD STICKERS ON THE BUCKET, AS WELL AS THE UN NUMBER (UN 2880). BOX AND BUCKET WERE BROUGHT BACK TO THE CAGE AND THE HAZMAT HELP DESK CALLED TO REPORT A POSSIBLE UNDECLARED HAZMAT

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due the pail being damaged during transmit resulting in the pail leaking. The released material impacted the concrete floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum along with impacted cardboard. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: Driver arrived to Devils Garden to load. Driver knows it takes 25 mins to load a full load of crude oil (1267). He began the loading process then went to sit in the cab because he says there were "too many bugs flying around" While sitting in the cab he did not realize the time passed and he overfilled the tanker spilling approximately 50 gallons of crude oil. This occurred on the Indian Reservation. NOTE - Selected 1203 gasoline because crude oil 1267 would not populate in the system.

item.title: Report X-2025051693
item.description:
Report X-2025051693

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-21
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF Supervisor states that one of her checkers Tyler Walker was moving trailer 550037 in the yard when he smelled a strong odor of rubbing alcohol coming from the trailer and reported it to the Supervisor. ABF Supervisor confirms the smell is strong and does not know how much has spilled out or how it became damaged. ABF Supervisor states that the leak is currently contained on the trailer and hasn't spilled out onto the yard. Safety did not advise Supervisor to open up the trailer and investigate due to the various amounts of poison and corrosive hazmat items on the trailer that could also be the culprit of the spill. Safety contacted CURA and they're dispatching a team out on emergency response to the spill. Cura reported one 5-gallon container of UN1155, Ethyl Ether, 3, I had been punctured and that a majority of the releasted Ethyl Ether had evaporated. Cura advised TLE personnel pat ched the 5-gallon container and collected it into one 55-gallon drum as hazardous waste.

item.description:
Report X-2025051995

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-21
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED IN THE UNLOAD TRAILER ON DOCK 8. THE UNLOADER NOTICED A FULLY REGULATED PACKAGE ON ITS SIDE WITH A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID LEAKING OUT OF THE CORNER. HE STOPPED UNLOADING, LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TUB. THE EQUIPMENT WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025050480
item.description:
Report E-2025050480

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-20
  • City: DORAL BRANCH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS AIR CARGO MIAMI FACILITY, ONE BULK SHIPMENT CONSISTING OF TWO COURIER BAGS AND TWO SKIDS WAS INSPECTED. A GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARK WAS SEEN BLEEDING THROUGH ONE OF THE WHITE COURIER BAGS. CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALS THIRTY-SIX BOTTLES OF FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS. TWELVE BOTTLES ARE MAX HOLD SPORT, 1.4 OZ CAPACITY, CLASSIFIED AS UN1219 ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL SOLUTION, PG II. TWELVE BOTTLES ARE ACTION SPRAY, 12 OZ CAPACITY, CLASSIFIED IN BULK AS UN1993 FLAMMABLE LIQUID, N.O.S. (PETROLEUM DISTILLATES, D-LIMONENE), PG III. TWELVE BOTTLES ARE TOP-LOC KNOT SEALER, 4 OZ CAPACITY, CLASSIFIED AS UN1993, FLAMMABLE LIQUID, N.O.S. (ISOPROPANOL). THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER FREIGHT OR AIR WAYBILL.

item.description:
Report E-2025050503

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-20
  • City: CLEVELAND
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 1130 et as service tech was fixing a placard on the outside of the trailer he was using a drill to drill out the rivet to remove the damaged placard and ran the drill bit through the side of the trailer and into a drum inside the trailer. This resulted in a small hole in the side of the drum allowing the material to slowly leek out. absorbent and a containment was placed under trailer. They then call our internal response team to address the leaking container. The team showed up at 1300et to proceed with the clean up. They dawned the proper ppe and began unloading the trailer to gain access to the drum. Once they gained access the drum was placed into a salvage container and the material that had been released was cleaned up using absorbents and placed into the salvage container for disposal. The team was complete at 1700et.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon poly drum due to a sharp object puncturing the drum. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized the cleanup material it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Another one (1) 55-gallon poly drum contained the damaged drum with waste product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060306
item.description:
Report E-2025060306

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-20
  • City: SIOUX FALLS
  • State: SD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0957 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XSO. It was reported that an unknown amount of battery acid UN2794 released from industrial battery due. The release impacted Door 9. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. XPO-XSO contacted ERTS regarding a large battery that tipped over in transit releasing battery acid onto the trailer floor and dock floor. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 5-gallon release onto the entire wooden trailer floor and an estimated 25-foot area on the concrete dock floor as a result of a load shift / inadequate preparation for transportation. The contractor applied baking soda and oil dry to the release and up righted the battery. One 55-gallon DF containing the neutralized spent absorbents and impacted shrink wrap was generated for waste disposal. The Shipper does not want the batter back, so that was also labelled for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025060301
item.description:
Report E-2025060301

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-20
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0138 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XQC. It was reported that approximately 8-oz of "Lithium Hydroxide" released from a paper bag due to getting punctured by a nail. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3194640. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site and recommended a contractor. XPO stated that they feel comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on site and declined contractor assistance. XPO will place the waste inside of a 25-gallon poly drum. ERTS generated waste ID 238277-1.

  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR EXPRESS CRITICAL SERVICE PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THERE IS A RED STICKER APPLIED THAT READS URGENT PERISHABLE, RUSH, FRAGILE, HANDLE WITH CARE, REFRIGERATE, AND DO NOT FREEZE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2025051644
item.description:
Report X-2025051644

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-19
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN GOODYEAR, ARIZONA, ONE AIR PACKAGE BROKE OPEN. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED NUMEROUS UNSECURED PANASONIC CR2032 LITHIUM METAL COIN CELLS WITHIN THE BOX. MOST OF THE SMALL COIN CELLS ARE IN PLASTIC HOLDERS DESIGNED TO HOLD TWO CELLS EACH WITH THE CELLS OPENLY EXPOSED. NUMEROUS CELLS ARE LOOSE WITHIN THE BOX WITHOUT THEIR PLASTIC HOLDERS. THERE IS NO PROTECTION AGAINST SHORT CIRCUIT. NO ENCLOSURES SURROUNDING THE COIN CELLS. NO ADDITIONAL INNER PACKAGING. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE REGULATED DANGEROUS GOODS ARE WITHIN THE BOX. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED DISCOVERY, THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM SDF TO PHX. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER H1A865, AMERICAN SCIENCE SURPLUS, 7410 N LEHIGH AVE, NILES IL 60714-4024.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO contacted ERTS regarding a leaking battery. I contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 2-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 25' x 8.5' area as a result of a load shift / improper loading. The contractor applied soda ash to the release to neutralize the spill and up-righted the battery. One drum of waste was generated containing the neutralized spill debris. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.
