  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: West Colton yard employees reported an odor near the trim tower in the outbound section of the West Colton yard. Crews were near SHPX 209523 which contained Petroleum Distillates NOS. UP Hazmat Manager K. Ahrens was in the area and responded to the car to investigate. Upon inspection of the car, the manway nozzle gasket was found rolled over on part of the manway nozzle, and the manway nozzle gasket was deteriorated and torn, allowing vapor to escape. The manway nozzle gasket was replaced, and the car was resecured stopping the release of vapors.

As per the Bill of Lading, Chemtrec was notified and issued report #20250519000014.

item.description:

  • City: EAST DEERFIELD

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TILX112017 was found leaking hydrochloric acid on Track 4W in Deerfield Yard. At approximately 2100 hours, Hepaco LLC, mobilized to site with three technicians, one supervisor, and one pickup truck. Hepaco LLC arrived onsite at 2330 hours and conducted safety briefing, received track protection. Hepaco worked with railroad and shipper to approve corrections. At 0200 hours TILX112017 tank car was corrected and secured. Hepaco secured area and decontaminated equipment that was used. Apparent cause of incident concluded (Liquid Line A was less than tool tight, Liquid Line B was missing a gasket on the blind flange, and there were multiple gaskets on vapor line flange. Gasket installed on flange, flange secured, and security seals attached.

item.title: Report E-2025060302
item.description:
Report E-2025060302

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-17
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOLE TRANSPORT, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 36150
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Solar Driver was heading to a local gas station for fuel delivery. He was on Interstate 25 Southbound in Albuquerque, NM when he struck a piece of road debris. This road debris punctured a hole in the saddle bag tank of his Tractor. Driver pulled over to check the damage near I-25 exit 221. At this time he sees the damage to the fuel tank and fuel leaking from it. He called 911 for help FD showed up in roughly 5 minutes and was able to patch the hole in the tank. Roughly 50 gallons was released onto the concrete and dirt where the unit was stopped. Once Solar Dispatch was contacted we dispatched Environmental Restoration to the scene for clean up. Once on site they determined the Fire Dept had cleaned the impacted concrete but the spill had migrated to the soil and roughly 30 feet down the hill that is in the area. The clean up crew deployed granular absorbents to soil to soak up any fuel and protect against any further migration. They also took soil samples at the site and determined the product seeped down 6 inches into the soil. Excavation of the area has been scheduled but Environmental Restoration and is going to take place on Thursday June 19th.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) cups of material released from one (1) 263-gallon poly tote due to an unknown reason causing the tote to leak. The released material impacted the dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The customer was contacted to see if they still wanted the IBC tote of product because it is no longer leaking. They are awaiting a response. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025051638
item.description:
Report X-2025051638

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-16
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ANCHORAGE, ALASKA ONE PACKAGE BROKE OPEN. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWELVE CANS OF FLAMMABLE PU SPRAY INSULATION FOAM, EACH AT 30 OUNCES. THE PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINS A SINGLE 9.8 OUNCE CAN OF FLAMMABLE PU FOAM GUN CLEANER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM VIRGINIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B44E86, FAME MARKETING AND TRADING LLC, 5844 CHURCHLAND BLVD, PORTSMOUTH VA 23703-3311. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING GROUND TO ALASKA RATE SERVICE, WHICH MUST TRAVEL IN THE AIR NETWORK.

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-16
  • City: MANOR
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The cubic yard box was discovered to be leaking while in temporary storage at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Manor, TX. An investigation revealed inner container leaked and soaked through the box and the cubic yard box did not have the proper liner in place or absorbent material. The spill was identified quickly and remediated appropriately. All other boxes from the same shipment were opened and inspected and repackaged with a liner installed.

item.description:
Report X-2025051652

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-16
  • City: MADISON HEIGHTS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A PARTIME SUPERVISOR FOUND A LEAKING PACKAGE IN TRAILER AT DOOR 91 AND CALLED FOR A RESPONDER. THE RESONDER ARRIVED TO THE SPILLED PACKAGE WITH PROPER PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT ON AND DECISION TREE IN HAND. APON ARRIVAL USING THE UPS DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER DETERMINED THAT THE SPILL WAS A FLAMMABLE LIQUID BY THE RED DIAMOND LABEL. THE RESPONDER CONTAINED SPILL IN A LINED SPILL TRAY AND TRANSPORTED THE LEAKING PACKAGE TO THE DAMAGE MATERIALS AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING PER WASTE DISPOSAL FOR A FULL DMP.

item.title: Report X-2025051619
item.description:
Report X-2025051619

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-16
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO ONE DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE FROM GERMANY THAT WAS LEAKING A LIQUID. THE OUTER PACKAGE WAS DECLARED AS UN1170, ETHANOL SOLUTION WITH A CLASS 3 DIAMOND LABEL AND SHIPPERS DECLARATION FOR DANGEROUS GOODS. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY IN GERMANY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWENTY-FIVE INNER BOTTLES OF CHEMAGIC BINDING BUFFER BLOOD WITH ONE LEAKING THE ENTIRE ONE LITER AMOUNT FROM WHAT APPEARS TO BE A DEFECTIVE CLOSURE. EACH INNER BOTTLE IS ONE LITER CAPACITY. THE PACKAGE AND ENTIRE CONTENTS HAVE BEEN DISPOSED OF PER NORMAL DISPOSAL PROCEDURES.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED ABOUT A SMELLY FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT ON THE PSI-1 SINGULATOR. RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH PPE ON, SPILL CART, AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DECISION TREE, WHICH LED THEM TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET. SINCE THERE WAS NO RELEASE FROM THE OUTER SIDE OF THE HAZMAT, ZEP ZORBENT WAS NOT NEEDED. RESPONDER SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT IN A SPILL TUB AND HEADED BACK TO THE PSC CAGE TO START PROCESSING IT. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DISPOSAL WASTE FLOW CHART, WHICH LED THEM TO FOLLOW THE DMP PROCEDURE. RESPONDER GATHERED THE CARDBOARD/PACKAGING MATERIAL AND LIQUID CONTAINERS INTO SEPERATED GREEN BAGS.

THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 63W400, FAIRE, 100 POTRERO AVE, SAN FRANCISCO CA 94103.

item.description:
Report X-2025051621

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-15
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT BAY 490, A LEAKING FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED. RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED ABOUT IT FROM RMP AND HEADED HIS WAY WITH PPE ON, SPILL CART, AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DECISION TREE, WHICH LED THEM TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET. SINCE THERE WAS NO LIQUID POURING OUT OF THE HAZMAT DIRECTLY, ZEP ZORBENT WAS NOT NEEDED. RESPONDER SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINED THE LEAKING FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE IN A SPILL TUB AND HEADED BACK TO THE PSC CAGE TO START PROCESSING IT. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DISPOSAL WASTE FLOW CHART, WHICH LED THEM TO START THE DMP PROCEDURE. RESPONDER PUT THE LIQUID CONTAINERS INTO THE FIRST GREEN BAG. SINCE A CONTAINER CAP WAS DAMAGED, A CONTAINER HAD TO BE SOLIDIFIED WITH ZEP ZORBENT. THE CARDBOARD AND ZEP ZORBENT WAS PUT INTO A SECOND GREEN BAG. RESPONDER DECONTAMINATED THEIR PPE FOR THE NEXT SPILL PICKUP.

item.description:
Report E-2025060111

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-15
  • City: NORTH CLARENDON
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10397
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Environmental Services, Inc. (CT) was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 20ft-by-5ft area of the trailer and estimated that fifteen (15) gallons of material was released due to one (1) 15-gallon drum being damaged. Environmental Services, Inc. (CT) personnel observed that all the released material had dried. All freight was unloaded from the trailer by contractor personnel, and they deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area. The leaking drum was overpacked into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and they secured the trailer. Contractor personnel followed the impacted truck to the nearest ESTES terminal located in Bellows Falls, VT. Environmental Services, Inc. (CT) then used three (3) 55-gallon poly drums to containerize the spent granular absorbents. All work was approved by the terminal supervisor after the contractor completed their clean-up. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal

SHE CALLED DISTRICT H S SUP FOR GUIDANCE. COURSE OF ACTION WAS TO DISASSEMBLE BAG RE-TEST PH ADD SODIUM BICARBONATE. UPON OPENING BAG, THIS WAS AT APPROX 11:00 PM, ADDING SODIUM BICARBONATE ORANGE COLORED FUMES THAT WERE NOXIOUS CAME OUT OF BAG. RMP, STILL IN FULL PPE CONTINUED USE OF DECISION TREE (GOGGLES/BOOTS/APRON/GLOVES) MOVED PKG TO OUTSIDE PROPERTY FENCING CONED OFF AREA, PER INSTRUCTIONS. MGR WKED ON CONTACTING CEC FOR DISPATCHING OF OUTSIDE RESPONDER. HAZMAT ONE ARRIVED 2 HRS LATER TO ADDRESS SPILL/NEUTRALIZE PLACE IN BARREL. THIS BARREL WAS LEFT ON SITE.

item.title: Report X-2025051623
item.description:
Report X-2025051623

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-15
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A STRONG SOLVENT-LIKE ODOR BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-A. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG SHE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN A FEW MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT A METAL 5-GAL PAIL WAS BREACHED AND HAD LEAKED APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL WITH ALOT OF ROOM FOR THE CONTAINER TO MOVE AROUND INSIDE OF THE CARTON. THE OUTER CONTAINMENT WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX RATED AT A 48 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

  • Description: DRIVER FROM MIRAMAR CENTER NOTICED A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE ON CAR DURING HIS ROUTE. HE DROVE THE CAR BACK TO THE BUILDING WITH THE LEAKING HAZMAT. ONCE HE RETURNED TO THE BUILDING RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED TO RESPOND TO THE LEAKER. THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING INSIDE THE PACKAGE CAR. RESPONDER CLEANED AND CONTAINED THE SPILL AND BROUGHT THE CONTAMINATED CONTENTS BACK TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA TO FURTHER THE DISPOSAL PROCESS. THE LEAKING PACKAGE WAS POTASSIUM HYDROXIDE INSIDE A 5 GALLON JUG. THE JUG HAD NO OUTTER FIBERBOARED BOX. THE JUG APPEARED TO HAVE A PUNCTURE HOLE ON THE BOTTOM OF THE CONTAINER. THE CONTENTS WERE SOLIDIFIED.

  • Description: Operations Supervisor III John Santos contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. John stated forklift operator Alexis Roy was attempting to move a staged pallet containing 5-gallon pails of UN1823, Sodium hydroxide, 8, PG II in Bay 67 for a dock pick-up. John stated that one of the 5-gallon pails broke through the bottom of the pallet. John stated when Alexis attempted to pick up the pallet the one of the blades on the forklift punctured the 5-gallon pail that broke through the bottom of the pallet resulting in a 1-liter spillage on to the forklift blade and the dock floor in Bay 67.

item.title: Report E-2025050524
item.description:
Report E-2025050524

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-14
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1031 EST, ERTS was contacted by Jack Martin of XPO Logistics (UPO) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately .25 teaspoon of Oxidate 5.0 (hazardous - UN3109) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the shrink wrap only as condensation. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The vented cap was tightened on the jug and sent to the Consignee, and the impacted shrink wrap was paced into a 20-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately ¼ tsp of UN3109 Oxidate 5.0 product released due to improper loading. The contractors opened and placed the drum which XPO had created into a vented 55-gallon poly drum and submerged the impacted shrink wrap with water. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025060185
item.description:
Report E-2025060185

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-13
  • City: UNIONTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0523 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XAC. It was reported that approximately 2-cups of Sodium Carbonate Peroxyhydrate released from a plastic bag due to unknown reasons. The release impacted inside of trailer #55413340. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of UN3378 Sodium Carbonate Peroxyhydrate product released to a 2’x3’ area of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading. The contractors utilized a HEPA vacuum to collect the dry powder and containerized the waste into a 55-gallon poly drum along with (1) bag of product and PPE. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2025050393

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-12
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 12, 2025, nineteen (19) 1-gallon pails of paint (PG II) and one (1) 4-gallon pail of paint (PG II) were damaged by a forklift and released approximately 15-20 gallons of product to the trailer interior, pallets, and nearby freight. The 1-gallon pails damaged include SHER-WOOD Color Express Precat Matte White Tint Base (3 pails), KEM 400 Enamel Blending Clear (8 pails), Polane T Polyurethane Enamel Blending Clear (8 pails). The one (1) damaged 4-gallon pail included POLANE B Polyurethane Enamel (Part A) Clear (PG II). R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the site. All of the damaged pails and the remaining product in the pails were containerized and solidified using absorbents within one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew utilized absorbent pads and granular absorbents to remove the paint from the trailer interior and adjacent freight, which were containerized in the previously mentioned 55-gallon drum. The impacted pallets were dismantled and containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

ALL CONTENTS HAVE BEEN DISPOSED OF PER NORMAL DANGEROUS GOODS DISPOSAL PROCEDURES.

  • Description: At 14:56 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO (XDE) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift puncture, approximately 30 gallons of 06L04000 CARIBOU HR OPV (hazardous - UN1139) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor at dock door #5. The terminal has requested a contractor out for cleanup and containment due to the confined trailer area - without good ventilation a respirator is possibly needed (Paul Flemming - SCM). There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 40 gallons of UN1139 06L04000 Caribou HR OPV product was released to entire wooden trailer floor and 60’x15’ concrete beneath trailer due to forklift puncture. The contractors generated (10) drums of impacted oil dri and (2) overpacked drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: t 1048 ET, XPO-XCW notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 5 cups of phycomycin scp released from a plastic bag due to no dunnage. The release impacted inside trailer#319-1512 and the concrete dock. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-cups of UN3378 Phycomycin SCP product was released to a 6’x2’ and 3’x1’ area of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading (dunnage). The contractors swept up the spilled material and restacked the pallet and placed the impacted bag into (1) 55-gallon poly tote. The swept up product was containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: CAPE CHARLES

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 9, 2025, at 0954 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Inway personnel in Kiptopeke, VA regarding the release of Sarnacol®-2170 VC Membrane Adhesive. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of approximately 1.0 cup of Sarnacol®-2170 VC Membrane Adhesive (UN1133, 3, II) from (1) 5-gallon plastic pail onto the trailer and asphalt. The release was reportedly due to the overtightening of a ratchet strap, impacting the trailer flatbed and asphalt. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with absorbents the proper PPE. Contractors removed the damaged pail from the trailer, placed it into an overpack, and re-secured the good product on the trailer flatbed. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DMs which were taken off-site by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060169
item.description:
Report E-2025060169

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: ELMENDORF
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MATRIX INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 30790
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On May 9, 2025. at 07:30 I've received a call from our driver. He noticed that there was a leak coming from a front end of the trailer and immediately called our office. The driver told me he was going to delivery at 15780 Alamo Jct. Elmendorf, TX 78112, he missed the left turn towards the Alamo Jct. (coming from the north on Richter Rd) and kept going south on Richter Rd and did a multipoint turn. That's where the load shifted and one of the IBCs got punctured by dunnage (wooden pallet, hole size 2 by 4) that shipper loaded up all the way in front of the trailer. A leak started and the driver called us immediately. If the shipper didn't load us with dunnage at the front of the trailer, the broken dunnage (pallet) wouldn't puncture the IBC even with the load shift that occurred. The duration of release was approximately 3hrs. No injuries or other damage were reported. I called Chemtrec (ER contact) and they advised me to call the Receiver (Univar) because they were just 20 yards down the road to have them try to contain the spill. On-site Univar Solutions personnel deployed granular absorbents and soda ash to contain and neutralize the release. Additionally, an 85-gallon drum was placed under the leaking tote to provide further containment until crews arrived. At approximately 8:29 AM CDT, a representative from Univar Solutions (US) retained Cura Emergency Services, L.C. (CES) to manage the environmental remediation of the site on their behalf. Based on the available information, the CES incident manager dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to assess and remediate the site as necessary.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-07
  • City: STEVENS POINT
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Wisconsin Central Railroad Ltd.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 34000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 07, 2025, A CN Mechanical employee observed liquid dripping from the bottom discharge cap of covered hopper car # SHPX432827 while performing rail car inspections on an outbound train at the Cn Stevens Point Wi. yard. The employee notified the on-duty transportation manager who in turn made all internal notifications to initiate a response to the incident. A CN emergency response contractor was dispatched to the location for inspection/ mitigation hopper car SHPX432827 (R) Last Contained Sodium Chlorate UN 1495, Class 5.1//PG II The CN contractor found the bottom discharge cap dripping product. The car was isolated for further investigation. The CN contractor secured the track by applying blue flag protection. The car was opened for internal inspection and found that the shipper failed to get all the liquid slurry removed, as well the camlock cap was not secured properly for shipment. The security seals were removed from the top hatch on SHPX432827 where the contractor noticed the liquid and product in the B end compartment, which was leaking out the bottom discharge. We will be solidifying the remaining product and off load the product into a highway container for disposal

  • Description: On 05/07/2025, a CN transportation employee observed liquid on the side of tank car # DPRX 258989 (Loaded / UN 1117 / Class 3) at the CN Flat Rock Yard located in Flat Rock, MI. Internal emergency response notifications were made to further investigate. The assessment of the tank car revealed that all 6 manway cover swing bolts were found to be less than tool-tight (easily turned by a gloved hand), preventing a proper seal of the manway cover, allowing the contents to leak during transportation. The manway cover was opened for gasket integrity inspection. The manway cover gasket was found to be intact without any noticeable defects. The manway cover swing bolts were properly tightened with a 24' pipe wrench.

  • Description: At 0013 ET on 5/7, XPO-NOF contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 3 ounces of Caustic Soda Micropearls from a 50lb paper bag onto the trailer floor. The bag was punctured by a forklift at LHO. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and confirmed the product to be a class 8 corrosive. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist with cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-cups UN1823 Caustic Soda Micropearls product released to a 1’x’1’ area of the wooden trailer floor due to forklift puncture. The crew generated (3) 55-gallon poly drums containing loose-packed product and spill debris. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Mike asked him the trigger questions like is there anything flammable or any aerosol cans. The shipper said no. When Mike screened the shipment, he saw two aerosol cans. He then proceeded to perform a physical search which turned up two aerosol cans, 2 bic lighters, waterproof matches, thermacell mosquito repellant, and seam grip seam sealer. Shipment was then put on hold.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed a small amount of material was observed around a drum’s bung cap were loose. The bung cap in question, along with three additional drum bung caps were secured. Each drum was staken to confirm integrity and no further issues were identified.

The released material impacted the concrete dock. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. Another 5-gallon poly drum was used to containerize the damaged product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: At 0116 EDT on 5/3, XPO-XCA contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1 cup of "Benzoyl Chloride" from a 55-gal poly drum onto the trailer and dock floors. The drum was loaded with a faulty seal and is spilling in motion. XPO personnel cannot handle the class 8 material. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist. ERTS reported the spill to Chemtrec and spoke to Alan who provided report number: 2025050300007. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of UN1736 Benzoyl Chloride product released to the top and sides of the poly drum impacting area 2’x2’ area due to improper packaging – bad seal on the bung cap. The contractors replaced the bung cap with a new one, and did a shake test. The crew removed the shrink wrap off the drum and wiped it down. (1) 55-poly drum was generated containing impacted PPE, absorbent rags, and shrink wrap. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2025060647
item.description:
Report X-2025060647

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-02
  • City: ANC
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer came to pickup shipment in ANC and then ship it out again to SLC with some cargo he brought. I delivered it to him, he got the shipment ready to be shipped out to SLC, and then I started creating an AWB for him. I asked about any lithium batteries, he said yes and that his boss asked him to connect all the batteries to the tools when he received it. I found out that he had 5 lithium batteries in one container(toolbox), and he didn't know of the watts. He said the batteries were declared in DLG, we went and looked at the shipment and I did not see any UN 3481 labels on the container but there was a NOTOC label dated for today. Customer then opened up the shipment and looked at the watts, finding 1 lithium battery at 140wh. I advised that was over the allowed limit for shipping through Cargo and will have to take it out. He then went through another container(tote) and found 2 more spare lithium batteries by themselves. He had 4 tools total, I instructed he connect the batteries to the tools and separate to 2 tools per container. He took away 3 spare lithium batteries from the shipment, 1 of which was over the limit. Customer was very pleasant throughout this experience and was very apologetic.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) ounces of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to the weight on the pallet that caused it to collapse damaging the pail. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum along with PPE. The metal pail of product was overpacked into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025051205
item.description:
Report X-2025051205

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-02
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 55000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: An odor was reported by UPRR yard personnel at 0732 in Livonia LA on 5-2-2025. Hazardous Materials Manager Tom Robinson was called for a response. Manager Robinson found AXLX 967 leaking from the pressure relief device at a very slow rate. The car was isolated in the haz mat track. HMM Robinson and a contractor used the crows foot wrench from the C-kit and tried to tighten the PRD mounting bolts. We were able to get a small turn on one of the bolts, however we thought the leak continued. The capping kit was applied to what we believed was a broken pressure relief device. The car was monitored for 48 hours and there was no pressure inside the can with the capping kit applied. A verbal OTMA was given to UPRR from Mark Maday with the FRA to move the car on ULIALR 4 on 5-4-2025. The car was delivered to Westlake at 2015 hours on 5-4-2025.

  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY WE RESPONDED TO ONE AIR PACKAGE DUE TO A STRONG ODOR COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (1) 8 OUNCE BOTTLE AND (1) 4 OUNCE BOTTLE OF FLAMMABLE ACETONE, (1) 8 OUNCE BOTTLE OF FLAMMABLE LIQUID MONOMER (UN1247 METHYL METHACRYLATE MONOMER STABILIZED) AND (1) 1 OUNCE BOTTLE OF FLAMMABLE OPI BOND AID (UN1173 ETHYL ACETATE). THERE ARE ASSORTED NAIL SALON RELATED PRODUCTS INSIDE THE PACKAGE. THERE IS ALSO ONE GELISH GO FILE HYBRID ELECTRIC FILE WITH AN INSTALLED LITHIUM-ION BATTERY, 36 WATT HOURS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM THE UPS STORE WITH A CONTACT RETURN NAME OF UNIQUE FLANEGIN.

The damaged bags were overpacked into (4) 55-gallon poly drums and did move back to the shipper.

  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. They observed approximately fifty (50) gallons of material released from one (1) plastic IBC tote due to a load shift damaging the tote. Clean Harbors completed the tote transfer and left the tote onsite. A new crew came from Clean Harbors and brought sixteen (16) bags of granular absorbents. They deployed granular absorbents to the affected area of the trailer floor and asphalt. Three areas of asphalt were affected in the parking lot. After clean-up procedures were completed, the generated waste consisted of two (2) totes and eight (8) 55-gallon drums of waste. The waste was staged on the corner at the back of the store's property. One week later the waste was transported to the ESTES Pine Brook terminal where it will remain for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060264
item.description:
Report E-2025060264

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-25
  • City: FORT LAUDERDALE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: JETBLUE AIRWAYS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: CALLER REPORTS (01) LITHIUM BATTERY RELEASED SMOKE INTO THE CABIN OF AN AIRCRAFT. THE SMOKE, POSSIBLY, CAME FROM A POWER BANK, IT IS UNKNOWN WHAT THE EXACT DEVICE WAS AS THE FIRE DEPARTMENT CONFISCATED THE ITEM. THE CAUSE OF THE RELEASE OF SMOKE IS UNKNOWN. THERE WAS NO DAMAGE TO THE ROW OR SEATS. THE INCIDENT OCCURRED ON A FLIGHT FROM FORT LAUDERDALE-HOLLYWOOD INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT TO PINDLING INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT IN NASSAU, BAHAMAS approximately 15 minutes prior to landing. A self-contained cell phone charger went into Thermal runaway and caught fire. The Crew immediately extinguished the fire and placed the charger in a water bath and secured it in the forward lavatory. Passengers deplaned normally through the JetBridge and ARFF team took possession of the charger. FLIGHT NUMBER 1593 1040 IS THE TIME THE INCIDENT OCCURRED IN THE BAHAMAS.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1:46 AM ET, UDV contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Henderson, CO. The spill consists of approximately 5 pounds of Metso Pentabead 20, which released from 1–50-pound paper bag due to a loading error prior to arrival that left the bag torn on the top corner, spilling onto the trailer floor. ERTS will dispatch for contractor assistance as this is a corrosive powder release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-10 pounds of UN3253 Metso Pentabead 20 product released from a 50-pound paper bag which was located at the top of the pallet which impacted 10’x3’ of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading. The team vacuumed the loose powder and restacked the product onto a new pallet. The damaged bag was containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum along with debris. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025050401

  • Description: At 0032 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at Terminal XDE. It was reported that 10 gallons of “UNKNOWN UN3500” were released from a damaged 1000-pound Cylinder. The release is impacting the trailer floor. ERTS was advised that the trailer has a strong smell and fumes. the Terminal is requesting contractor support to clean the released product and inspect the metal cylinders. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to clean up, inspect, and containerize the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 12-gallons of UN3500 Delta-Therm AE 7105 Isocyanate product released from the 1000-pound metal cylinder to 15’x8’ wooden trailer floor and 2’x2’ area of concrete due to valve was open from strap that got hung up on it when tightened. The crew cleaned the release using granular absorbents and rags and placed them into (1) 55-gallon metal drum along with PPE. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 1330 ET, XPO-XSJ notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 5-6 cups of UN 2796. The release impacted inside trailer#321-4542 and the concrete underneath the trailer. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. An ETA will be provided once it is known. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of UN2796 Smart Shine product released to the wooden trailer floor and concrete area due to container failure. The crew applied water and baking soda to the impacted surfaces, then absorbed with granular absorbents. The damaged drum was overpacked in an 85-gallon poly drum and neutralized absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

The release impacted trailer # 4632281. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cup release of UN3286 Biocide 3750W which impacted a 1’x1’ area of the trailer floor and 1’x1’ area of the asphalt below the trailer. The crew overpacked the 55-gallon poly drum into a 95-gallon poly drum. The release was then cleaned using oil dri which was worked in, then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was taken to XPO terminal where it will be staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Removed all these pieces from the shipment and can send the rest of the household goods.

  • City: LEESBURG

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver failed to make sure that his hose connection to the ground was secure and had a spill of approximately 15 to 20 gallons of diesel. After hooking up for the diesel delivery, the driver pulled the handle to start flow and immediately noticed the hose / drop fitting come loose and the release of product. The driver immediately closed the discharge handle and stopped the flow. He then used absorbent pads to clean up the spill. He also used some dirt near the curbing to make a dam and absorb some flowing product. CDG was contacted to manage the cleanup.

  • Description: MWCX 461433 was involved in a derailment in the Galesburg, IL yard on 3/28/25. MWCX 461433 sustained a puncture due to a coupler bypass. MWCX 461433 released approximately 100 pounds of product due to the puncture. One injury occurred and the train was eventually sent on its way. Hopper Car SIRX 525280 was discovered at a later time (2037) and location was about 40 miles from the original occurrence (City - Kewanee, County - Henry, IL). SIRX 525280 released approximately 25 pounds of product.

  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Spill while unloading from the external valve of 100 + gallons of sodium sulfide solutions onto gravel. Driver did not check the bleeder valve for obstruction in the valve before coupling to discharge line. Driver cap the discharge line to get a sample for the customer before coupling the discharge hose to the bleeder valve. Driver opened the internal and external valves to get a sample. When the driver opened the bleeder valve no product . Driver then opened the discharge cap causing the spill.

(Replicating questions 14-29) Isopropanol or Isopropyl alcohol//haz class 3 // UN 1219//not shipped as hazardous waste//not toxic by inhalation//not shipped under Exemption, Approval, or CA number//shipment was undeclared with no release//packaging type non-bulk/outer packaging plastic box// Replicating questions 14-29) UN3481, Lithium Ion Batteries, contained in equipment //not shipped as hazardous waste//not toxic by inhalation//not shipped under Exemption, Approval, or CA number//shipment was undeclared with no release//packaging type non-bulk/outer packaging plastic box// Replicating questions 14-29) UN1266, Perfumery products //not shipped as hazardous waste//not toxic by inhalation//not shipped under Exemption, Approval, or CA number//shipment was undeclared with no release//packaging type non-bulk/outer packaging plastic box// SAW IMAGE ON X RAY THAT LOOKED LIKE IT MIGHT BE LITHIUM BATTERIES. PERFORMED PHYSICAL SEARCH AND FOUND MULTIPLE UNDECLARED HAZMATS. FULLY REGULATED LITHIUM ION BATTERIES(NOT IN EQUIPMENT) (5) UN3480 HAND SANITIZERS (3) COLOGNE(2) - ONE WITH A FLAMMABLE SYMBOL ON THE BOTTOM GAMER GRIP DRY HAND FORMULA(CONTAINING ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL) (1) ZIPPO LIGHTER(1) UN3481 CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT(12) UNDECLARED W/NO LABEL VAPES(2)

item.title: Report E-2025060243
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: EAST BOSTON
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: JETBLUE AIRWAYS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CUSTOMER STATES THAT WHILE IN DESCENT ON BOARD A A321 AIRCRAFT (AIRCRAFT REGISTRATION # N946JL) ON FLIGHT 988 FROM LAX TO BOSTON, A FIRE OCCURRED, RELEASING SMOKE INTO THE PLANE CABIN WHEN HIS PIXLE 8 BECAME WEDGED IN THE SEAT BACK AS HE MOVED IT TO THE UPRIGHT POSITION FOR LANDING AT BOS. THIS CAUSED THE LITHIUM ION BATTERY WITHIN TO GO INTO THERMAL RUNAWAY. NO INJURIES OR DAMAGES REPORTED.
